meanings.definition: To behave in an ingratiating or insincerely flattering manner.
meanings.sent1: She was smarming the teacher to get a better grade.
meanings.sent2: He always smarms his way into getting what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The salesman was smarming the customer with fake smiles.
meanings.sent4: Her smarming was so obvious, it made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The politician's smarming was like a snake charmer hypnotizing the crowd.

meanings.definition: Excessively flattering or ingratiating in a way that is perceived as insincere.
meanings.sent1: I don't trust his smarming compliments.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a smarming smile that made me suspicious.
meanings.sent3: The smarming tone of his voice made me roll my eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her smarming behavior was so over-the-top, it was cringeworthy.
meanings.sent5: The smarming salesman's pitch felt like a bad soap opera scene.
